item.title: Join us this Thursday, April 15 at noon to call your state...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Join us this Thursday, April 15 at noon to call your state representatives and ask them to support SB62. The time to act is now. RSVP: https://bit.ly/3x0xza2
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Instead of being treated like the son, uncle and human being...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Instead of being treated like the son, uncle and human being that he was, Michael Marshall was criminalized for living with mental illness and homelessness. That bias cost him his life. “Uncle Michael was never violent, yet he was crushed by officers for over 15 minutes,”- Natalia Marshall. Under SB62 he might still be alive. Read Michael Marshall’s story: https://passsb21062.org/michael-marshalls-story
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: If we care about racial justice in our criminal justice system...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

If we care about racial justice in our criminal justice system then SB 62 deserves Colorado’s strong support. We know who the harms of our broken system fall heaviest upon — people of color. With so much evidence that mass incarceration and heavy-handed policing are failing us, we need to find a different way, a better way, and that’s what this bill is.

https://www.denverpost.com/…/mass-incarceration-bail-bond-…/

With so much evidence that mass incarceration and heavy-handed policing are failing us, one of the things we should all agree on is we need to find a different way, a better way, and that’s what Co…

denverpost.com

Opinion: Colorado must address mass incarceration and racial disparities in police arrests

With so much evidence that mass incarceration and heavy-handed policing are failing us, one of the things we should all agree on is we need to find a different way, a better way, and that’s what Co…With so much evidence that mass incarceration and heavy-handed policing are failing us, one of the things we should all agree on is we need to find a different way, a better way, and that’s what Co…
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: “It took 7 minutes and 43 seconds to kill my brother in that...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

“It took 7 minutes and 43 seconds to kill my brother in that jail. It took 7 minutes and 46 seconds to kill George Floyd. Just three seconds separate the time it took to kill these two Black men. If SB21-62 had been passed in 2010, my brother would have been handed a summons instead of being arrested. He would have never been dragged into that jail. It makes me wonder: How might he have spent those 7 minutes and 48 seconds that killed him? Enough is enough."

Read Reverend Spencer Lamar Booker's letter at: https://aclu-co.org/say-his-name-marvin-booker/
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Activists in rural Colorado, join this summit and learn how to...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Activists in rural Colorado, join this summit and learn how to embark on the meaningful, long-term work of organizing to ensure the needs of rural communities are met by those elected to represent them. Special guests include leaders from deep in the trenches of rural change-making.

https://www.facebook.com/events/752323055658445

item.title: Dana Steiner, a queer and trans person, and survivor of partner...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Dana Steiner, a queer and trans person, and survivor of partner violence knows there were many things that could have protected her, but jailing people for low-level offenses was not one of them. "It doesn’t make sense to me as a survivor why we would perpetuate such violence against people for minor offenses.” Listen to survivors. Support SB21-62.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: "Much of the time it’s the breadwinner who faces...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

"Much of the time it’s the breadwinner who faces deportation, forcing the rest of their family into the dilemma of choosing between paying lawyer fees or paying rent and buying food." Liceth Bañuelos on the need for a CO Legal Defense Fund.

A new state level bill, HB21-1194, hopes to provide universal representation to immigrant. The importance of Universal Representation.

elcomerciodecolorado.com

Guest Columnist – The importance of Universal Representation -

A new state level bill, HB21-1194, hopes to provide universal representation to immigrant. The importance of Universal Representation.A new state level bill, HB21-1194, hopes to provide universal representation to immigrant. The importance of Universal Representation.

item.title: “Boulder is currently holding up progress in Colorado when we...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

“Boulder is currently holding up progress in Colorado when we could be setting up an example,” said Kristen Eller.

It's time to push past the misinformation surrounding SB62. Colorado must pass this bill and end a pattern of mass incarceration.

City will support SB21-62 — ending cash bail and pre-trial jail time for lesser crimes — with slight changes

boulderbeat.news

Boulder changes tune on jail reform bill - Boulder Beat

City will support SB21-62 — ending cash bail and pre-trial jail time for lesser crimes — with slight changesCity will support SB21-62 — ending cash bail and pre-trial jail time for lesser crimes — with slight changes
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: "As a survivor of the most devastating crime, I know that...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

"As a survivor of the most devastating crime, I know that the solution to crime is not to invest more of our resources into mass incarceration, and I am tired of hearing law enforcement speak on behalf of survivors when they argue that more police and more prisons will protect us." Said Sharletta Evans, founder of Colorado Crime Survivors Network.

"This broken system hurts the most vulnerable and fails us all."

Jeff Bridges for Colorado Kolker for Colorado

Jails have become our default "solution" to societal issues like homelessness, substance use disorder and mental illness, even though incarceration further destabilizes people by jeopardizing their jobs, housing and healthcare.

sentinelcolorado.com

LETTERS: Reducing jail populations will make stronger, safer communities - Sentinel Colorado

Jails have become our default "solution" to societal issues like homelessness, substance use disorder and mental illness, even though incarceration further destabilizes people by jeopardizing their jobs, housing and healthcare.Jails have become our default "solution" to societal issues like homelessness, substance use disorder and mental illness, even though incarceration further destabilizes people by jeopardizing their jobs, housing and healthcare.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: After being arrested on a non-violent charge of trespassing,...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

After being arrested on a non-violent charge of trespassing, Michael Marshall experienced a psychiatric episode and deputies held him down until he died. People of color, people living with mental illness and people experiencing poverty are disproportionately impacted by cash bail. Michael Marshall was failed by a system that continually oppresses people who share his identities. The system is killing us. It is time to pass SB21-62.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: We need to dramatically change a system that treats people who...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

We need to dramatically change a system that treats people who are mentally ill or disabled as if they were criminals, even if they commit crimes. And we need to dramatically change a system that often delivers one kind of justice for privileged white people and a completely different kind of justice for everyone else. - The Sentinel

It doesn’t mean all criminals get a bye, it simply means that the government and society recognize the clear difference between criminals and people who at, one time, committed a crime.

sentinelcolorado.com

EDITORIAL: Aurora should offer real 2nd chances to convicts, not just good advice - Sentinel Colorado

It doesn’t mean all criminals get a bye, it simply means that the government and society recognize the clear difference between criminals and people who at, one time, committed a crime.It doesn’t mean all criminals get a bye, it simply means that the government and society recognize the clear difference between criminals and people who at, one time, committed a crime.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Los problemas de salud mental de Jerid Thistle empeoraron cuando...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Los problemas de salud mental de Jerid Thistle empeoraron cuando fue encarcelado con una fianza de $5000 que no pudo pagar. Aunque el fiscal y el defensor público acordaron que Jerid era seguro para ser liberado con una fianza no monetaria, el juez tomó la decisión de rechazar su liberación. Después de desintoxicarse solo en la cárcel de Alamosa durante tres días, Jerid murió por suicidio. El suicidio es una de las principales causas de muerte en la cárcel. Demasiados habitantes de Colorado se han suicidado mientras estaban en la cárcel con una fianza monetaria. Bajo SB21-62, probablemente habrían vivido. Un sistema de justicia que requiere dinero a cambio de libertad cuesta vidas.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Thank you to everyone who participated in our annual Lobby Day. We hope to see you again next year.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: If we as a community value safety and fairness, rich and poor...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

If we as a community value safety and fairness, rich and poor alike, supporting SB21-62 is an easy choice. It gives discretion to police and judges to jail those who are dangerous without filling our jails with people who are simply cannot afford to buy their freedom.

Annette James is the President of the NAACP Boulder County. Dan Williams is a partner at the law firm Hutchinson Black and Cook, LLC

But to our enormous disappointment, Boulderites opposed allowing people the opportunity to live outside of jail pre-trial.

dailycamera.com

Guest Opinion: Some Boulderites Demand To Jail The Poor While the Rich Go Free

But to our enormous disappointment, Boulderites opposed allowing people the opportunity to live outside of jail pre-trial.But to our enormous disappointment, Boulderites opposed allowing people the opportunity to live outside of jail pre-trial.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Jerid Thistle’s mental health struggles worsened when he was...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Jerid Thistle’s mental health struggles worsened when he was jailed on a $5000 bond that he was unable to pay. Although the prosecutor and the public defender agreed that Jerid was safe to be released on a non-monetary bond, the judge made the decision to refuse his release. After detoxing alone in the Alamosa Jail for three days, Jerid died by suicide. Suicide is a leading cause of death in jail. Too many Coloradans have died by suicide while held in jail on money bond. Under SB21-62, they would likely have lived. A justice system that requires money in exchange for freedom costs lives.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: What happens when you give part of your state tax refund to us...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

What happens when you give part of your state tax refund to us through the Donate to a Colorado Nonprofit program? Your gift is anonymous, automatic and directly supports our work. Use our reg. number 20023005801.

Donate from your state income tax refund to a Colorado charity. It’s simple, fast and puts you in charge of where your gift goes.

refundwhatmatters.org

ReFUND CO: Give Back to a Nonprofit

Donate from your state income tax refund to a Colorado charity. It’s simple, fast and puts you in charge of where your gift goes.Donate from your state income tax refund to a Colorado charity. It’s simple, fast and puts you in charge of where your gift goes.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: This year, we are committed to bringing our neighbors home by...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

This year, we are committed to bringing our neighbors home by safely lowering jail populations and keeping our immigrant neighbors out of detention, and you can help. Collaborate with us in this year's ACLU of Colorado Lobby Day and train in defending civil liberties in our state. RSVP: https://aclu.zoom.us/…/register/tZcqce2hqjkoHNDnAUyaq-PozAA…
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Mass incarceration has led to overcrowded jails and prisons, and...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Mass incarceration has led to overcrowded jails and prisons, and the needless deaths of Michael Marshall, Marvin Booker, and countless others across Colorado. We are long overdue for serious change. Take action now and urge your legislators to support safely reducing the number of people held pretrial in Colorado jails. https://action.aclu.org/send-message/co-sb21-062
item.author: ACLU of Colorado
